Authors:
Thao Phuong Nguyen, Toshimitsu FUKIHARU, Kiminori SHIMIZU,
Dung Anh Nguyen
Title:
Coprinopsis yokdonensis sp. nov., a new coprophilous fungus
from highland Vietnam
Keywords:
Agaricales, Elephant dung, Subsection Nivei, Taxonomy, Yok
Don National Park.
Abstract:
A new coprophilous species, Coprinopsis yokdonensis
(Basidiomycota, Agaricales, Psathyrellaceae) is described as a new
coprophilous fungus from Asian elephant (Elephas maximus) dung in
Vietnam. Based on morphological characters and phylogeny analysis
inferred from ITS rDNA gene sequences, species is compared with related
species in subsection Nivei. With veil characters (sub) golobose
elements and densely elongate diverticulate hyphae, long ellipsoid
basidiospores, small size golobose cheilocystidia and lack of
pleurocystidia, C. yokdonensis species can be classified. In phylogeny
analysis, C. yokdonensis comes close to C. nivei and C. igarashii but
these species differ in veil characters and existing of
pleurocystidia.
